title: Fajita Marinade Recipe
description: Delicious fajita marinade made with lime juice, olive oil, and soy sauce, and spiced up with cayenne and black pepper. Makes enough marinade for 2 pounds of meat.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Marinade Recipes Fajita Marinade 4.6 (853) 623 Reviews 32 Photos This fajita marinade with lime juice and olive oil is spiced up with cayenne pepper. It adds so much flavor to the meat for delicious fajitas. Submitted by Robbie Rice Updated on May 9, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 32 32 32 32 Prep Time: 15 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 16 Yield: 2 cups Jump to recipe This fajita marinade recipe results in tender, flavorful, melt-in-your-mouth meat every time.  Fajita Marinade Ingredients These are the simple, kitchen staple ingredients you’ll need to make this homemade fajita marinade ingredients:  Water: This easy fajita marinade starts with ⅓ cup water. Lime juice: Lime juice lends bright flavor and helps tenderize the meat. Olive oil: Two tablespoons of olive oil keeps the meat moist. Garlic: Fresh garlic lends a bold flavor. Soy sauce: You’ll need two tablespoons of olive oil. Salt: A teaspoon of salt enhances the other flavors. Liquid smoke: Liquid smoke adds umami-rich flavor. Cayenne: A pinch of cayenne pepper gives the fajita marinade subtle heat. Black pepper: Ground black pepper is the perfect finishing touch.  How to Marinate Fajitas Simply whisk the ingredients together in a bowl. That’s it! You’ll find the full, step-by-step instructions (with marinating directions) in the recipe below. Can You Reuse Fajita Marinade?  You may be tempted to reuse the marinade straight from the bag, but it will not be safe to use as-is. In fact, the bacteria from the raw meat could make you very, very sick. All that flavorful fajita marinade doesn't have to go to waste, though: You can make it safe-to-eat by boiling the liquid for several minutes. This process will also reduce the liquid, resulting in a thick sauce that'll work well with your homemade fajitas. . Learn more: How to Safely Reuse a Meat Marinade Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “This is an excellent marinade, particularly if you have the time to do it overnight,” according to John McArthur. “When I have less time I add about 50% more lime juice so the acid breaks down the muscle better.” “This recipe makes fajitas that are addictive,” raves one Allrecipes community member. “And I ought to know — I'm from Texas! I scaled this to 20 servings for a party and used half the marinade for top round steak and half for chicken breasts.” “I love Mexican food,” says Medora Jensen. “This recipe has resurrected two dishes for my family. Quesadillas and fajitas. I use cooked, left over chicken and shred it with the marinade. I cook some peppers, onions and garlic, add the shredded chicken and voila!” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings ⅓ cup water ¼ cup lime juice 2 tablespoons olive oil 4 cloves garlic, crushed 2 teaspoons soy sauce 1 teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon liquid smoke flavoring ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper ½ teaspoon ground black pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk water, lime juice, olive oil, garlic, soy sauce, salt, and liquid smoke flavoring together in a bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in cayenne and black pepper until combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Use to marinate 2 pounds of meat; marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours to overnight before cooking as desired. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,040 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Fajita Marinade 01 of 32 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 32 Photo by  daisy 02/10/2021 03 of 32 Photo by  Rhonda Herring Camacho 03/19/2020 It was so juicy and I left it marinating in the fridge over night. Turned out delicious. 04 of 32 Photo by  Miechele James Summers 08/27/2019 I use this recipe on a regular basis. The only change I make is that I don't add the water. Even if I don't have two hours to marinate the food, it still makes it taste yummy in a few minutes, but best if you can give it time. 05 of 32 Photo by  Julie Rains 07/21/2019 I had avoided trying to make fajitas for years, afraid they would be to hard to make well. This marinade made great tasting fajitas easy! I work a lot so I put some pre-cut stir fry meat into the marinade on Thursday for dinner Friday evening. Leaving only veggie prep for Friday. I cooked the meat first then removed it from the cast iron skillet I was using to cook the onions. The onions deglazed the pan nicely, becoming coated in the cooled down marinade, then I added the bell peppers and extra marinade to finish cooking, adding the meat back to come up to Temp after the rest was cooked and the marinade and juices had formed a thick sauce. Heaven! 06 of 32 Photo by  Jen White Watson 06/07/2019 07 of 32 Photo by  Spenner Frank 05/03/2019 08 of 32 Photo by  Wendy F 11/15/2018 This is a great Fajita marinade! definitely a keeper! I added a few more spices, some cumin and a little coriander, extra cayenne for a little bit more heat, and instead of water, I used beer. it turned out amazing! Thanks for sharing 09 of 32 Photo by  Kevin N Kathy Holder 05/01/2018 10 of 32 Photo by  mjasonlane 02/06/2015 Great marinade! I add some cilantro to it! 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Cerveza and Lime Marinade for Shrimp and Fish 30 Ratings Beef Fajita Marinade 34 Ratings Mediterranean Chicken Marinade 32 Ratings Carne Asada Marinade 96 Ratings Mediterranean Meat Marinade 4 Ratings Kerry's Really Easy Lemon-Pepper Marinade 2 Ratings Ginger and Rosemary Pork Marinade 31 Ratings Chicken and Turkey Marinade 90 Ratings Rum Chicken Marinade 11 Ratings Asian Chicken Marinade for Grilling 1 Rating Easy Citrus Marinade for Grilled Chicken Thighs 1 Rating Garlic and Herb Marinade 65 Ratings Angelyn's Marinade 31 Ratings Chicken Thigh Marinade 3 Ratings Stroka's Steak Marinade 10 Ratings Shawarma Marinade for Chicken 5 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
